content: On July 12, 1998, the Atlanta Braves faced the New York Mets at Turner Field in a thrilling game that showcased the team's resilience. The Braves rallied from a 7-1 deficit to win 8-7, highlighted by a dramatic three-run homer from Chipper Jones in the eighth inning. This comeback victory was a testament to the Braves' tenacity during a season in which they ultimately reached the postseason, reinforcing their dominance in the National League during the late 1990s.
